questions.question:
<p>If &lsquo;A&rsquo; denotes &lsquo;+&rsquo;, &lsquo;B&rsquo; denotes &lsquo;&times; &rsquo;, &lsquo;C&rsquo; denotes &lsquo;&ndash;&rsquo; and &lsquo;D&rsquo; denotes &lsquo;&divide;&rsquo;, then what will come in place of &lsquo;?&rsquo; in the following equation?</p>

<p>18 A 23 C 6 B (96 D 16) A 3 B 12 = ?</p>
questions.solution:
Explanation : 

Given equation : 18 A 23 C 6 B (96 D 16) A 3 B 12 = ?

⇒ 18 + 23 - 6 × (96 ÷ 16) + 3 × 12 

⇒ 18 + 23 - 6 × 6 + 3 × 12

⇒ 18 + 23 - 36 + 36

⇒ 77 - 36

⇒ 41

Hence, 41 is the correct answer.

questions.question: If all the vowels are removed from the English alphabet, then what will come at the 15th position in the new alphabetical series?

B C D F G H J K L M N  P Q R S T  V W X Y Z

The 15th letter in the new alphabetical series:

 B C D F G H J K L M N P Q R S T V W X Y Z  

The 15th letter in the new alphabetical series is Letter "S".

Hence, the correct answer is "Letter S".

questions.question: The Indian National Congress was established when_____ delegates from all over the country met at Bombay in December 1885.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 72.

Key Points

  • On 28 December 1885, the Indian National Congress was founded at Gokuldas Tejpal Sanskrit College in Bombay, with 72 delegates in attendance.
  • The founder of the INC was Allan Octavian Hume. It was founded in Mumbai.
  • It was formed when 72 delegates from all the presidencies and provinces of India met at Bombay from 28 to 30 December 1885.
  • Allan Octavian Hume played a leading role in the formation of the Congress and acted as its General Secretary.
  • It was set up to bring together a group of educated individuals on a common platform to influence policymaking.
  • Some of the important leaders, who attended this first session of the congress which was held at the Gokuldas Tejpal Sanskrit College:
    • Dadabhai Naoroji, Kashinath Trimbak Telang, Pherozeshah Mehta, S.Subramania Iyer, P. Ananda Charlu, Dinshaw Edalji Wacha.
    • Gopal Ganesh Agarkar, G. Subramania Iyer, M. Veeraraghavarchariar, N.G. Chandavarkar, Rahmatullah M. Sayani and Womesh Chandra Bonnerjee.
    • An important leader who was absent was Surendranath Banerjee. He had convened a national conference around the same time at Calcutta.
  • The first president of the congress was Womesh Chandra Banerjee. 
  • Congress passed nine resolutions that demanded changes in British policy and reforms in administration.

Additional Information

  •  Aim and Objectives of the Congress :
    • Promotion of friendship among the countrymen.​
    • Development and consolidation of a feeling of national unity irrespective of race, caste, religion, and provinces.
    • Formation of popular demands and presentation before the Government through petitions.
    • Training and organization of public opinion.
    • Consolidation of sentiments of national unity.
    • Recording of the opinions of educated classes on pressing problems.
    • Laying down lines for the future course of action in the public interest.

questions.question: Which of the following region was the capital of the Chalukyas?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Aihole.

Key Points:

  • Aihole in Karnataka state, India, is known as the Cradle of Indian architecture.
  • It was the first capital of Chalukyas where they built numerous temples dating back to the 6th century CE. 
  • Later the capital was changed to Badami by Pulkeshin 1 in 543.

Additional InformationChalukya dynasty:

  • It lasted from 543A.D. to 755 A.D.
  • Pulakesin I was the founder of the Chalukya dynasty.
  • He established a small kingdom with Vatapi or Badami as its capital.
  • The Western Chalukyas ruled over an extensive area in the Deccan for about two centuries after which the Rashtrakutas became powerful.
  • The family of Western Chalukyas had its offshoots like the Eastern Chalukyas of Vengi and the Chalukyas of Kalyani.
  • Kirtivarman II was the last of the rulers of the Chalukyas.
  • He was defeated by Dantidurga, the founder of the Rashtrakuta dynasty.

questions.question: Which of the following Indian states receive rainfall during October and November due to the North-East monsoon?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Option 4. 

Key Points

  •  Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal region of the Union Territory of Puducherry are the Indian states that receive rainfall during October and November due to the North-East monsoon.
  • The North-East monsoon, also known as the retreating monsoon, brings rain to these regions after the Southwest monsoon season ends.
  • The North-East monsoon is an important source of rainfall for these regions, and it is critical for agriculture and other economic activities in the area.

Additional Information

  •  The monsoon in India is a seasonal wind system that brings heavy rainfall to the Indian subcontinent during the summer months of June to September.
  • The monsoon is a result of the differential heating of land and water, which causes a low-pressure area to form over the Indian subcontinent, attracting moist air from the Indian Ocean.
  • The monsoon is a critical source of water for agriculture, as well as for other economic and social activities in India.
  • The monsoon season in India is divided into two parts: the Southwest monsoon and the North-East monsoon.
    • The Southwest monsoon brings rain to most parts of the country, while the North-East monsoon brings rain to parts of southern India, including Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and the Karaikal region of the Union Territory of Puducherry.
    • The monsoon is a complex and dynamic system, and it can have a significant impact on the economy and society of India, both positively and negatively.

questions.question: Kalinga is the ancient name of coastal______.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Option 2. 

Key Points

  •  Kalinga is the ancient name of a region in eastern India that corresponds to the present-day states of Odisha and parts of northern Andhra Pradesh.
  • It was a significant coastal region known for its rich cultural heritage and maritime trade.
  • The history of Kalinga dates back to ancient times, with references to the region found in texts such as the Mahabharata and the Puranas.
  • Kalinga was renowned for its seafaring abilities and flourishing trade connections with other parts of India and foreign lands.
  • The region was known for its maritime trade in goods like textiles, spices, precious stones, and other commodities.
  • Kalinga also had a rich political history. It was ruled by several dynasties and was often engaged in power struggles with neighboring kingdoms.

Additional Information

  • One of the most notable events in the history of Kalinga was the Kalinga War in 261 BCE.
  • This war was fought between the Mauryan Empire, led by Emperor Ashoka, and the Kalinga Kingdom.
  • The war had a significant impact on Emperor Ashoka, who was deeply affected by the destruction and loss of life, leading him to embrace Buddhism and renounce violence.
  • Over time, the name Kalinga fell out of use, and the region came to be known by different names during various historical periods.
  • The present-day state of Odisha, which encompasses a significant portion of the ancient Kalinga, has a diverse cultural heritage and is known for its art, architecture, dance, and festivals. The coastal areas of Odisha have beautiful beaches and are popular tourist destinations.

questions.question: In India the residuary powers to legislate any matter that is NOT mentioned in the three federal lists lies with the ______.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Union Legislature.

Key Points

  • Union Legislature
    • The Indian Union Legislature serves as both the country's legislative body and the hub of all democratic political activity.
    • The central legislature is the Parliament, and the state legislature is referred to as the "State Legislature."
    • The Rajya Sabha (the Council of States) and the Lok Sabha, make up India's bicameral parliament, (the House of the People).

Additional Information

  • Supreme Court- 
    • The Supreme Court of India is the supreme judicial body of India and the highest court of the Republic of India under the constitution. 
    • The Chief Justice of India is the head and chief judge of the Supreme Court, which consists of a maximum of 33 judges under him.
    • Article 124 has provisions for the establishment and organizational structure of the Supreme court. 
    • SC of India was established on 1st October 1937 as the Federal Court of India.
    • H J Kania was the first Chief Justice of India.
    • Sir Maurice Gwyer was the first chief justice of the Federal Court of India prior to the formation of the Supreme Court of India. 
  • State Legislature
    • In India's states and union territories, the legislature is known as the State Legislative Assembly, commonly known as Vidhan Sabha or Saasana Sabha.
    • It is the only legislative body in the 28 states and 3 union territories that have a unicameral state legislature, and in 6 states that have bicameral state legislatures, it is the lower house, with the State Legislative Council serving as the upper chamber. 
  • Ministry
    • ​The administration of the Companies Act 2013, the Companies Act 1956, the Limited Liability Partnership Act of 2008, and the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code of 2016 are the primary concerns of the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, a department of the Indian government.

questions.question: Which type of tax acts as an automatic stabiliser in the economy?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Proportional income tax.

Key Points

  • Proportional income tax can act as an automatic stabilizer in the economy because it changes in response to changes in income levels.
  • This means that as income levels rise or fall, the tax burden for individuals and households changes proportionally, which can help to stabilize the economy during periods of economic growth or recession.
  • During periods of economic growth, when income levels rise, the government collects more revenue from income taxes.
  • This increased revenue can be used to fund government spending programs or to reduce the budget deficit.
  • The government can also use this increased revenue to reduce taxes or to provide tax incentives, which can further stimulate economic growth.

Additional Information

  • Professional tax
    • ​ is a tax levied by some state governments in India on individuals who earn an income through professions, trades, callings or employment.
    • It is a form of tax that is collected by the state government, and the rates and rules may vary from state to state. 
    • The professional tax is usually deducted by the employer from the salary of the employee and then remitted to the state government.
    • The amount of professional tax that an individual has to pay depends on the monthly or annual income earned, as well as the state in which the individual is employed.
    • The purpose of the professional tax is to help state governments generate revenue for their various development projects and public services.
    • It is a mandatory tax that must be paid by individuals who are liable to pay it, and failure to do so can result in penalties and fines.
  • Wealth tax:
    • ​A tax on an individual's net wealth or assets.
    • A form of direct taxation aimed at reducing wealth inequality.
    • Levied annually based on the value of an individual's assets at a particular point in time.
    • Can be applied to a range of assets including cash, property, investments, and personal possessions.
    • The tax rate is usually a percentage of the net value of these assets and can vary depending on the level of wealth.
    • Used by some countries to generate revenue and fund public services
  • Capital gains tax:​
    • Capital gains tax is a tax on the profit earned from the sale of an asset, such as stocks, real estate, or artwork.
    • It is a form of direct tax that is imposed by the government on the capital gains realized by an individual or a business.
    • When a person or a business sells an asset, the capital gain is the difference between the selling price of the asset and the purchase price or the cost basis of the asset.
    • The capital gains tax is then calculated based on the capital gain realized.
    • The capital gains tax rate can vary depending on the asset, the length of time the asset was held, and the taxpayer's income level.

questions.question: Which of the following waterways separates India from Sri Lanka?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Palk Strait.

Key Points

A strait is a narrow channel of water that joins two water bodies and separates two land masses.

  • Palk Strait
    • The strait is between southeastern India and northern Sri Lanka.
    • The southwestern portion of the strait is also called Palk Bay.
    • The strait is named after Robert Palk, who was a governor of Madras during the Company Raj period.
    • The strait is 40 to 85 miles (64 to 137 km) wide, 85 miles long, and less than 330 feet (100 meters) deep.
    • It receives several rivers, including the Vaigai (India), and it contains many islands on the Sri Lankan side.
    • The port of Jaffna, the commercial center for northern Sri Lanka, lies on the strait.

Additional Information

Important Points

questions.question: ______,also known as search unemployment, occurs when workers lose their current job and are in the process of finding another one.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Frictional unemployment. 

Key Points 

  • Frictional unemployment is a type of unemployment that occurs when workers move from one job to another job.
  • It is sometimes called search unemployment and can be based on the circumstances of the individual.
  • Frictional unemployment is time spent between jobs when a worker is searching for a job or transitioning from one job to another.​

Additional Information

  • Seasonal unemployment occurs when people are unemployed at particular times of the year when demand for labor is lower than usual.
  • Technological unemployment occurs when developments in technology and working practices cause some workers to lose their jobs. Technological unemployment is considered to be part of a wider concept known as structural unemployment.
  • Cyclical unemployment is the component of overall unemployment that results directly from cycles of economic upturn and downturn. Cyclical unemployment is the impact of economic recession or expansion on the total unemployment rate.

questions.question: Who is the father of the modern ecology?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Option 3. 

Key Points

  •  The father of the modern ecology is considered to be Eugene Odum, an American ecologist who is widely regarded as one of the pioneering figures in the development of modern ecology.
  • Odum is known for his groundbreaking work on ecosystem ecology, which focuses on the relationships between living organisms and their physical environment.
  • He also developed the concept of "ecosystem," which is a functional unit of living organisms and their physical environment.
  • Odum's work has had a significant impact on the field of ecology, and he is credited with helping to establish ecology as a distinct scientific discipline.

Additional Information

  • Robert Brown was a Scottish botanist and biologist who made significant contributions to various fields of science.
    • He is best known for his discovery of Brownian motion, which refers to the random movement of microscopic particles suspended in a fluid or gas.
  • Charles Darwin was an English naturalist and biologist who is best known for his contributions to the theory of evolution.
    • He is famous for his book "On the Origin of Species," published in 1859, in which he proposed that all species of life have evolved over time from a common ancestor through a process of natural selection.
    • This theory revolutionized the field of biology and had a profound impact on scientific thinking and society as a whole.
  • Robert Hooke was an English scientist who lived from 1635 to 1703.
    • He was a polymath, making significant contributions to a wide range of scientific fields, including physics, chemistry, biology, and astronomy.
    • Hooke is best known for his work in microscopy, which allowed him to observe and describe a wide range of microscopic structures and organisms.

questions.question: Bharatanatyam is a classical dance of ____________ in southern India.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Tamil Nadu.

Key Points

  • Bharatanatyam originated in Tamil Nadu.
  • Bharatanatyam is the oldest Indian classical dance and it originated hundreds of years ago in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu.
  • This dance form expresses the religious themes and spiritual ideas of South India.
  • The ancient Tamil epic Silappatikaram contains the description of Bharatanatyam.
  • The Sangeet Natak Akademi currently confers classical status on eight Indian classical dance styles: Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu), Kathak (North, West and Central India), Kathakali (Kerala), Kuchipudi (Andhra Pradesh), Odissi (Odissa), Manipuri (Manipur), Mohiniyattam (Kerala), and Sattriya (Assam).

questions.question: Who won the Miss World 2024 title?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Krystyna Pyszkova. In News
  • Krystyna Pyszkova from the Czech Republic won the Miss World 2024 title in Mumbai. 

Key Points
  • She succeeded Karolina Bielawska from Poland as the reigning Miss World.
  • Pyszkova is the second Miss World winner from the Czech Republic, following Tatana Kucharova in 2006.
  • She is a Czech model pursuing degrees in law and business administration.
  • Pyszkova founded the Krystyna Pyszko Foundation and advocates for sustainable development through education.
  • Fluent in multiple languages, including English, Polish, Slovak, and German, she opened an English school for underprivileged children in Tanzania.
  • Pyszkova enjoys playing the transverse flute and the violin and has a passion for music and art.

Additional Information

  • Sini Shetty, representing India, made it to the top 8 but was not the winner.

questions.question: Who&nbsp;took the oath of Office and Secrecy as Member, UPSC, on February 1, 2024?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Sanjay Verma

In News

  •  Shri Sanjay Verma, Indian Foreign Service of 1990 batch, took the oath of Office and Secrecy as Member, UPSC, on February 1, 2024.

Key Points

  • The oath was administered to him by the UPSC Chairman Dr. Manoj Soni.
  • Shri Verma joined the Indian Foreign Service in 1990 and has held various positions in India and abroad, including Ambassador to Spain and Andorra, Ambassador to Ethiopia, Djibouti, and the African Union, Consul General in Dubai, and Spokesperson and Counsellor (Press, Information, and Culture) at the Indian Embassy in Kathmandu, among others.
  • He has also served in various capacities at the Ministry of External Affairs, including the China Desk, Aide (OSD) to the Spokesperson, Joint Secretary (DG), Energy Security, and Chief of Protocol.
  • Shri Verma holds a Master's degree in International Studies from Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi, and is a recipient of the Dorabji Tata Scholarship. 
  • He enjoys reading, music, popular Indian culture, and films, and is a university-level hockey player.

questions.question: &#39;सुधा&#39; किसका पर्यायवाची है?
questions.solution:
सही उत्तर है - ‘अमृत’।

  • ‘सुधा’ शब्द ‘अमृत’ का पर्यायवाची है।
  • अमृत के अन्य पर्यायवाची शब्द : अमिय, सुरभोग, देवान्न, शुभा, मधु, जीवनोदक, सोम, देवाहार, अमी आदि।​ 

Key Pointsअन्य विकल्प :

  • स्त्री के पर्यायवाची शब्द : वनिता, महिला, औरत आदि।
  • चंद्र के पर्यायवाची शब्द : शशि, रजनीश, राकापति, राकेश, निशाकर, विधु, मयंक आदि।
  • पुत्री के पर्यायवाची शब्द : बेटी, आत्मजा, तनुजा, सुता, तनया, लड़की, नन्दिनी, दुहिता, कन्या आदि।

Important Pointsसमानार्थी शब्द :

  • वे शब्द जिनका अर्थ एक समान होता हैं समानार्थी शब्द कहलाते हैं।
  • समानर्थी शब्द को हम पर्यायवाची शब्द भी कहते है। ‘पर्याय’ का अर्थ है ‘समान’ तथा ‘वाची’ का अर्थ है ‘बोले जाने वाले’ अर्थात
    समान बोले जाने वाले शब्दों को हम पर्यावाची शब्द या समानार्थी शब्द कहते है।

पर्यायवाची शब्द के उदाहरण :

  • झरना- उत्स, स्रोत, प्रपात, निर्झर, प्रस्त्रवण।
  • तसल्ली- दिलासा, ढाढ़स, सांत्वना।
  • ज्योतिषी- दैवज्ञ, गणक, भविष्यवक्ता, खगोलज्ञ।
  • कंगाल- निर्धन, गरीब, रंक, धनहीन।

questions.question:
निम्‍नलिखित गद्यांश का ध्‍यानपूर्वक अध्‍ययन कर प्रश्‍नों के उत्‍तर दीजिए-

सामान्यतः दुष्‍टों की वंदना में या तो भय रहता है या व्यंग्‍य, परंतु जहां हम हानि होने के पहले ही हानि के कारण की वंदना करने लगते हैं वहां हमारी वंदना के मूल में भय नहीं बल्कि उसकी स्थाई दशा की आशंका है। इस वंदना में दुष्‍टों को थपकी देकर सुलाने की चाल है जिसमें विघ्‍न बाधाओं से जान बच सके। आशंका से उत्पन्न या नम्रता गोस्वामी जी को आश्रय से आलंबन बना देती है। जब स्‍फुट अंशों के संचारी भावों तथा अनुभवों को छोड़कर वंदना के पीछे निहित भावना की दृष्टि से देखते हैं, तो यह आश्रय से संक्रमित आलंबन का उदाहरण बन जाता है। संतों, तों देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त नहीं इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक सृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी उपहास्‍य बना देती है। 

उपर्युक्‍त गद्यांश में निम्‍नलिखित में से किस शब्‍द का प्रयोग नहीं किया गया है?
questions.solution:
उपर्युक्‍त गद्यांश में अनाश्रय शब्‍द का प्रयोग नहीं किया गया है। 

Key Points

  • वंदना:
    • यह शब्द सम्मान, पूजा, और आदर की भावनाओं को व्यक्त करता है।
    • किसी व्यक्ति, देवता, या प्रतीक के प्रति श्रद्धा और सम्मान का एक रूप होती है।
  • भावना:
    • यह एक हिंदी शब्द है जिसका अर्थ होता है भाव या अनुभूति। यह शब्द आवेग, इच्छा, भाव, और मनोभाव को व्यक्त करता है।
  • आलंबन:
    • यह शब्द सहारा, समर्थन, या आधार का अर्थ रखता है।
    • किसी चीज़ को समर्थन या आधार के रूप में इस्तेमाल करने की क्रिया को इसके द्वारा व्यक्त किया जा सकता है।
  • अनाश्रय:
    • इस शब्द का अर्थ होता है बिना किसी सहारे के, या बिना किसी आधार के।
    • यह शब्द किसी व्यक्ति, चीज़, या स्थिति का वर्णन करने के लिए उपयोग होता है जिसमें कोई समर्थन या सहारा नहीं होता है।

questions.question:
निम्‍नलिखित गद्यांश का ध्‍यानपूर्वक अध्‍ययन कर प्रश्‍नों के उत्‍तर दीजिए-

सामान्यतः दुष्‍टों की वंदना में या तो भय रहता है या व्यंग्‍य, परंतु जहां हम हानि होने के पहले ही हानि के कारण की वंदना करने लगते हैं वहां हमारी वंदना के मूल में भय नहीं बल्कि उसकी स्थाई दशा की आशंका है। इस वंदना में दुष्‍टों को थपकी देकर सुलाने की चाल है जिसमें विघ्‍न बाधाओं से जान बच सके। आशंका से उत्पन्न या नम्रता गोस्वामी जी को आश्रय से आलंबन बना देती है। जब स्‍फुट अंशों के संचारी भावों तथा अनुभवों को छोड़कर वंदना के पीछे निहित भावना की दृष्टि से देखते हैं, तो यह आश्रय से संक्रमित आलंबन का उदाहरण बन जाता है। संतों, तों देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त नहीं इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक सृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी उपहास्‍य बना देती है। 

उपर्युक्‍त गद्यांश के अनुसार, कौन-सा कथन पूर्णताः सही है?
options: संतों, देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त है, इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना नहीं की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक सृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी उपहास्‍य बना देती है।
संतों, देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त नहीं इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक सृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी उपहास्‍य बना देती है।
संतों, देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त नहीं है इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना नहीं की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक सृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी उपहास्‍य बना देती है।
संतों, देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त नहीं इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक दृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी खतरनाक बना देती है।
questions.solution:
उपर्युक्‍त गद्यांश के अनुसार, पूर्णताः सही कथन है- संतों, देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त नहीं इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक सृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी उपहास्‍य बना देती है।

Key Points

  • इस पाठ में, लेखक कहते हैं कि संतों, देवताओं, और राम की वंदना तो हम सभी करते हैं, लेकिन उन्होंने एक अनूठे दृष्टिकोण को उजागर करते हुए कहा है कि दुष्टों की वंदना भी महत्वपूर्ण हो सकती है।
  • उनका मत यह है कि दुष्टों की वंदना करने से उनके महत्व की एक विशेष रूप से बहुमुखी दृष्टि होती है, जो उन्हें और अधिक उपहास्‍य बना सकती है।

questions.question:
निम्‍नलिखित गद्यांश का ध्‍यानपूर्वक अध्‍ययन कर प्रश्‍नों के उत्‍तर दीजिए-

सामान्यतः दुष्‍टों की वंदना में या तो भय रहता है या व्यंग्‍य, परंतु जहां हम हानि होने के पहले ही हानि के कारण की वंदना करने लगते हैं वहां हमारी वंदना के मूल में भय नहीं बल्कि उसकी स्थाई दशा की आशंका है। इस वंदना में दुष्‍टों को थपकी देकर सुलाने की चाल है जिसमें विघ्‍न बाधाओं से जान बच सके। आशंका से उत्पन्न या नम्रता गोस्वामी जी को आश्रय से आलंबन बना देती है। जब स्‍फुट अंशों के संचारी भावों तथा अनुभवों को छोड़कर वंदना के पीछे निहित भावना की दृष्टि से देखते हैं, तो यह आश्रय से संक्रमित आलंबन का उदाहरण बन जाता है। संतों, तों देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त नहीं इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक सृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी उपहास्‍य बना देती है। 

उपर्युक्‍त गद्यांश के अनुसार, दुष्‍ट वंदना के पीछे लेखक का क्‍या उद्देश्‍य है?
options: दुष्‍टों को भी वंदना का आर्शीवाद देना।
दुष्‍टों को भी परस्‍पर सम्‍मान दिलाना।
questions.solution:
गद्यांश के आधार पर, दुष्‍ट वंदना के पीछे लेखक का उद्देश्‍य है- "दुष्‍टों को थपकी देकर सुलाना।"

Key Points

  • यहां लेखक वंदना की अद्वितीय भावना को वर्णन करते हैं, जिसमें उनका उद्देश्य दुष्टों को 'थपकी देकर सुलाना' हो सकता है।
  • यह संकेत करता है कि वंदना का उद्देश्य हो सकता है कि दुष्ट व्यक्ति को कुछ हद तक अपने दुष्ट कर्मों से विचलित या विघ्नित करना है, जिससे वे अन्यों को कम नुकसान पहुंचा सकें।

questions.question:
निम्‍नलिखित गद्यांश का ध्‍यानपूर्वक अध्‍ययन कर प्रश्‍नों के उत्‍तर दीजिए-

सामान्यतः दुष्‍टों की वंदना में या तो भय रहता है या व्यंग्‍य, परंतु जहां हम हानि होने के पहले ही हानि के कारण की वंदना करने लगते हैं वहां हमारी वंदना के मूल में भय नहीं बल्कि उसकी स्थाई दशा की आशंका है। इस वंदना में दुष्‍टों को थपकी देकर सुलाने की चाल है जिसमें विघ्‍न बाधाओं से जान बच सके। आशंका से उत्पन्न या नम्रता गोस्वामी जी को आश्रय से आलंबन बना देती है। जब स्‍फुट अंशों के संचारी भावों तथा अनुभवों को छोड़कर वंदना के पीछे निहित भावना की दृष्टि से देखते हैं, तो यह आश्रय से संक्रमित आलंबन का उदाहरण बन जाता है। संतों, तों देवताओं तथा राम की वंदना पर्याप्त नहीं इसलिए दुष्‍टों की भी वंदना की जाती है। इससे दुष्टों के महत्व की भायिक सृष्टि होती है और वह उन्हें और भी उपहास्‍य बना देती है। 

उपर्युक्‍त गद्यांश के लिए निम्‍न में से सर्वाधिक उचित शीर्षक का चयन कीजिए-
options: गोस्वामी तुलसीदास जी का मानीय दृष्टिकोण।
questions.solution:
उपर्युक्‍त गद्यांश का सर्वाधिक उचित शीर्षक है- वंदना का महत्‍व।

Key Points

  • इस गद्यांश में, वंदना, या पूजन, दुष्टों के प्रति की जाती है, और उसके विभिन्न पहलुओं पर विचार किया गया है।
  • वंदना का उपयोग भय, व्यंग्य, आशंका और आलंबन के रूप में वर्णित किया गया है।
  • गद्यांश उनके महत्व को समझाने का प्रयास करता है और यह सुझाव देता है कि वंदना का उपयोग किसी को और अधिक उपहास्य बनाने के लिए भी किया जा सकता है।

questions.question:
<p><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; white-space-collapse: preserve; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline;">Directions: Select the option that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word and mark your response accordingly</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; white-space-collapse: preserve; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline;">.</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-633de470-7fff-2f54-8da8-099eaaa2496e"><span style="  background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">She made an </span><span style="  background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">obscure</span><span style="  background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;"> reference to an ancient philosopher in her speech.</span></span></p>
options: Clear
Well-known
Cryptic
Obvious
questions.solution:
The correct answer is “Cryptic”.

 Key Points

  • 'Obscure' refers to something not discovered or known about; uncertain. (अस्पष्ट)
    • Example- The meaning behind the poet's obscure verses was debated by scholars.
  • 'Cryptic' signifies something having a meaning that is mysterious or obscure. It fits the context of being hard to understand due to its complexity or ambiguity. (रहस्यपूर्ण)
    • Example- The cryptic message left us puzzled for days.
  • Hence, the option that is Similar in meaning to the given word is 'Cryptic’.

Therefore, the correct answer is ‘Option 3’.

 Additional Information

  • Clear indicates something easy to perceive, understand, or interpret. (स्पष्ट)
  • Well-known describes something recognized by many people. (प्रसिद्ध)
  • Obvious is used for something easily perceived or understood; clear, self-evident, or apparent. (स्पष्ट)

questions.question:
<p>Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.</p>

<p><strong>Duty</strong></p>
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Option (2) i.e. "Exemption".

Key Points

  • Duty: (कर्तव्य) - A moral or legal obligation; a responsibility. (Customs duty refers to the tax imposed on goods when they are transported across international borders.)
    • Example: It's my duty to take care of them.
  • Exemption: (छूट) - The process of freeing or state of being free from an obligation or liability imposed on others.
    • Example: Children are granted exemption from attending school.

Therefore, the correct answer is "Exemption".

Additional Information

  • Selection: (चयन) - The action or fact of carefully choosing someone or something as being the best or most suitable.
  • Option: (विकल्प) - A thing that is or may be chosen.
  • Loophole: (चूक) - An ambiguity or inadequacy in the law or a set of rules.

questions.question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate idiom to fill in the blank.</strong></p>

<p>I think we should ________ before buying this car.</p>
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'hold our horses'.

Key Points

  • The most appropriate idiom to fill in the blank is: hold our horses.
  • "Hold our horses" means to wait or be patient before taking action. In this context, it suggests that the speaker thinks they should wait or be patient before making a decision about buying the car. 
  • Meanings of other options:
    • "Eat like a horse": This idiom means to eat a lot or have a hearty appetite. It is unrelated to the context of the sentence.
    • "Stop to change horses": This idiom refers to the practice of stopping during a journey to switch horses. It does not fit the context of the sentence.
    • "Get off our high horse": This idiom means to stop acting arrogantly or superior. It is unrelated to the context of the sentence.

questions.question:
<p>Complete the following proverb.</p>

<p>A bird in hand is ________.</p>
options: more valuable than two on the tree
questions.solution:
The correct answer is "worth two in the bush."

Key Points

  • "A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush."
    • This proverb means that having something that is certain and within your grasp is more valuable than trying to pursue something that may be uncertain or difficult to attain. It advises people to be content with what they have rather than taking unnecessary risks to get something that may not even exist.
    • The proverb is used to encourage people to appreciate what they have, rather than constantly chase after something that might be better.
      • For example, "I was tempted to quit my stable job to pursue a more high-paying position, but then I remembered the proverb "a bird in hand is worth two in the bush" and decided to stay put."
  • Options 1, 2, and 4 are incorrect; they don't make sense with the actual question.

Hence, the correct answer is "worth two in the bush."

questions.question:
<p dir="ltr">Direction: Fill in the blanks with appropriate word.</p>

<p dir="ltr">You will feel better _______ you take the medicine.</p>
questions.solution:
The Correct Answer is Option 2) 'if'.

 Key Points

  • The sentence indicates a condition for an event to happen in the future.
  • In the first conditional sentence, the word 'if' is typically used to express such a condition.
  • Therefore, option 2 "if" is the correct choice as it aligns with the requirements of a first conditional sentence.
  • Other options - "when", "because", "even though" - do not appropriately express this conditional relationship in the sentence.

Therefore, the correct answer is - 'if'

Additional Information

  • "When" (Option 1) is used to refer to a specific time or upon something happening, not to express a condition that might or might not be fulfilled. 
  • "Because" (Option 3) is used to provide a reason for something, not to present a conditional situation.
  • "Even though" (Option 4) is used to express a contrast or contradiction, not a condition.

questions.question:
<p>Fill in the blanks with appropriate word.</p>

<p>My sister and _____ are pleased to&nbsp;accept your invitation.</p>
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'I'.

 Key Points

  • This statement requires the subjective pronoun after 'and'.
  • The use of 'I' after 'and' is most appropriate because it's a subjective pronoun and it becomes the subject of the sentence jointly with 'My sister'.
  • Subjective pronouns like 'I' are used as the subject of a sentence, in this case "I am pleased to accept your invitation".
  • Therefore, the correct option would be 'I' as it goes with the grammar use of subjective pronouns.

Therefore, the correct answer is Option 1.

 Additional Information

  • 'Me' is an objective pronoun and should not be used with conjunctions like 'and' unless it becomes the object of a verb or preposition in the sentence.
  • 'Myself' and 'I myself' are reflexive pronouns and are used when the subject and object refer to the same person, and is not grammatically appropriate in this sentence.

questions.question:
<p><span style="font-weight: bolder;">Parts of the following sentence have been given as options. Select the option that contains an error.</span></p>

<div>The breathtaking sceneries of the mountains and lakes left us in awe during our hike through the national park.</div>
options: our hike through the national park
questions.solution:
The erroneous part is 'The breathtaking sceneries of'.

Key Points

  • The sentence has an error in the word "sceneries." The correct form should be "scenery" (singular), not "sceneries" (plural).
  • The corrected sentence would be: "The breathtaking scenery of the mountains and lakes left us in awe during our hike through the national park."
  • "Scenery" is a mass noun, meaning it doesn't typically have a plural form. It refers to the overall visual aspects of a landscape or view, encompassing natural features such as mountains, lakes, forests, and so on. It's an uncountable noun used to describe the collective visual impression of an area.
  • For example:
    • "The coastal scenery in that region is stunning."
    • "The rural scenery in the countryside was serene and picturesque." 
  • In the corrected sentence, "scenery" is used to describe the combined visual beauty of mountains and lakes, and it remains singular because it represents the overall landscape or view, not individual components.

Additional Information

  • Other nouns which are always used in singular form: Scenery, information, furniture, advice, machinery, stationery, news, poetry, business, mischief, fuel, issue, repair, bedding.

questions.question:
The digital revolution has indisputably reshaped our society, permeating virtually every facet of life. We live in a hyperconnected era, where the boundary between the real and virtual worlds is increasingly blurred. Though its benefits are myriad, it's worth pausing to consider the potential downsides of this digital immersion.

On the one hand, technology has democratized information, fostering global connectivity and accessibility. The internet, smartphones, and various digital platforms have empowered us with the ability to learn, communicate, and collaborate like never before. They have catapulted us into an era of unprecedented convenience and opportunity, where we can virtually traverse the globe with a simple click.

Yet, this digital immersion also comes with pitfalls. The unending influx of information can overwhelm our cognitive capabilities, leading to information overload. The constant bombardment of updates, notifications, and messages can disrupt our focus, leading to a condition known as "digital fatigue." Further, it's alarming to see the increasing prevalence of cyberbullying, privacy breaches, and disinformation campaigns, which have severe consequences on our societal harmony.

The digital revolution is a double-edged sword. It grants us unparalleled access to knowledge, yet it can also breed distraction, misinformation, and anxiety. We need to strike a balance, leveraging the best of what technology offers while mitigating its downsides. As we continue to navigate this digital landscape, it's crucial to remember that technology is merely a tool—it's how we use it that ultimately defines its impact.

What is one of the benefits of the digital revolution mentioned in the passage?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'Democratized information'. 

Key Points

  •  The passage states: "technology has democratized information, fostering global connectivity and accessibility."
  • This means that information is more accessible to everyone, regardless of their location or status, thanks to digital technology.
  • Based on the above given points, it is clear that  one of the benefits of the digital revolution as mentioned in the passage is 'democratized information'. 

Therefore, the correct answer is Option 2.

Which word from the passage is most similar in meaning to "immersion"?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'Involvement'.

Key Points

  •  "Immersion" in the given passage refers to being deeply involved or fully engaged in something.
    •  Ex - John's immersion in his work allowed him to produce exceptional results." 
  • "Involvement," means actively participating or being engaged in a particular activity or situation. 
    • Ex -  School officials say they welcome parental involvement.
  • So, it is clear that 'immersion' and 'involvement' are similar in meaning. 

Thus, the correct answer is Option 3. 

Additional Information

  • Separation :the act of dividing or disconnecting ; coming apart.
  • Isolation: The state of being alone or separated from others. It represents the opposite of involvement or engagement.
  • Detachment: The act of disconnecting or separating oneself from something. It signifies a lack of involvement or disengagement.

questions.question: Human body contains
questions.solution:
The correct answer is about 70% water.

Important Points

  • The Top Four Elements Found in the Human Body: oxygen (65%), carbon (18.5%), hydrogen (9.5%), nitrogen (3.2%).
  • The other trace elements (less than 0.01%) are boron (B), cadmium (Cd), chromium (Cr), cobalt (Co), copper (Cu), fluorine (F), iodine (I), iron (Fe), manganese (Mn), molybdenum (Mo), selenium (Se), silicon (Si), tin (Sn), vanadium (V), and zinc (Zn).
  • The six major nutrients are carbohydrates (CHO), lipids (fats), proteins, vitamins, minerals, water.
  • The functions of water in the human body:
    • Water carries nutrients and oxygen to all cells in the body.
    • Water is required for breathing.
    • Water regulates your body temperature.
    • Water protects and cushions vital organs.
    • Water cushions joints.
    • Water removes waste.

Key Points

  • Calcium (Ca) is the most abundant mineral in the body and is essential for a number of vital functions.
    • Also helps muscles relax and contract, important in nerve functioning, blood clotting, blood pressure regulation, immune system health.
  • Iron (Fe), Part of a molecule (haemoglobin) found in red blood cells that carries oxygen in the body, needed for energy metabolism.
  • Iodine found in thyroid hormone, which helps regulate growth, development, and metabolism.
  • Chromium works closely with insulin to regulate blood sugar (glucose) levels.

questions.question: Thiamine deficiency is usually caused due to :
options: When people consumed more polished rice
Throwing excess water after cooking rice
questions.solution:
The correct answer is All of the above.

Key Points

  • When people consume more polished rice:
  1. ​ Polished rice is white rice that has had its outer brown layer removed, which includes the bran and most of the germ.
  2. This process removes many nutrients, including thiamine (Vitamin B1). Therefore, diets predominantly consisting of polished rice can lead to thiamine deficiency.
  • Adopt improper cooking practices:
  1. Improper cooking practices, such as cooking at high temperatures and for prolonged periods, can destroy thiamine present in the food.
  • Throwing excess water after cooking rice:
  1. ​Thiamine is water-soluble, which means it can leach into the water when you cook rice.
  2. If we throw away the excess water after cooking, we also throw away any thiamine that had leached into the water, contributing to a potential deficiency.

questions.question: <p>What makes colostrum a crucial component of breast milk?</p>
questions.solution:
Colostrum is the first form of milk produced by the mammary glands of mammals immediately following the delivery of a newborn. It differs considerably from regular breast milk and contains several crucial elements needed for the baby's development. The choices given are high sugar content, antibodies and protective elements, fatty acids for muscle development, and lactose for digestion.

Key Points

Colostrum is often referred to as the baby's "first vaccine" due to its rich composition of antibodies and protective elements.

  • These antibodies, particularly Immunoglobulin A (IgA), help protect the newborn against bacteria and viruses by forming a protective layer on the mucous membranes in the baby's intestines, throat, and nose.
  • This is particularly significant as the newborn's own immune system is still developing.
  • High sugar content, fatty acids for muscle development, and lactose for digestion, while important nutrients for the baby, are standard components of both colostrum and later stages of breast milk. Although they have their own advantages, they are not what designate colostrum as unique or primarily crucial.

As such, the substantial presence of antibodies and protective elements is what gives colostrum its critical role in the early days of an infant's life, aiding in the provision of immunity before the baby's own immune system begins to mature.

questions.question: Nutrients are obtained from food by the process of metabolism that takes place in the following steps excepts _____.
questions.solution:
Concept:

  • Metabolism is defined as the sum of all chemical reactions required to support cellular function and hence the life of an organism. 
  • Anabolism, which covers all metabolic activities involved in creating larger molecules, and Catabolism, which refers to all metabolic processes involved in molecular breakdown, are the two categories under which metabolism is classified. 
  • In general, anabolic processes need energy and catabolic processes release it.
  • Transporting materials and transferring energy are the two main objectives of metabolism.
  • Food macronutrients are converted into cellular energy, which is then used to carry out cellular work.
  • Metabolism transforms the matter of macronutrients into substances a cell can use to grow and reproduce and also into waste products.

Explanation:

  • Digestion: The process of digestion involves a number of steps that break down food into its constituent parts.
  • Starches (carbohydrates), proteins, lipids, and a large number of vitamins, minerals, and other substances are all found in food, and they are all bound together by a variety of chemical, electrical, and mechanical bonds.
  • These bonds are broken down during digestion, dividing the contents into their individual parts.
  • Steps of Metabolism:
  • Absorption is the process of moving nutrients from the intestines into the bloodstream. Most nutrients are absorbed through the lining of the small intestine, but water-soluble nutrients are absorbed differently from fats and fat-soluble compounds.
  • Metabolism converts nutrients into forms that can be used (or stored in the body), and also into forms that are removed (excreted) from the body. 
  • Assimilation is the process of absorption of vitamins, minerals, and other chemicals from food as part of the nutrition of an organism.

Additional Information

  • Vitamins and minerals are micronutrients required by the body to carry out a range of normal functions.
  • Vitamins are organic substances that are generally classified as either fat-soluble or water-soluble.
  • Fat-soluble vitamins (vitamin A, vitamin D, vitamin E, and vitamin K) dissolve in fat and tend to accumulate in the body.
  • Water-soluble vitamins (vitamins C and B )
  • Minerals are inorganic elements present in soil and water, which are absorbed by plants or consumed by animals.
  • For example calcium, sodium, and potassium, there is a range of other minerals, including trace minerals (e.g. copper, iodine, and zinc) needed in very small amounts.

questions.question: Angular stomatitis, glossitis, cheilosis are the deficiency symptoms of:
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Riboflavin deficiency.

Key Points

  • Angular Stomatitis: Riboflavin deficiency can lead to angular stomatitis, which is the inflammation and cracking of the corners of the mouth.
  • Glossitis: It is another symptom of riboflavin deficiency, which is characterized by inflammation of the tongue leading to changes in color and texture, often making it appear swollen, smooth and shiny.
  • Cheilosis: Cheilosis, also known as cheilitis, involves inflammation and cracking of the lips, specifically along the borders of the lips.
  • Seborrheic Dermatitis: Riboflavin deficiency can result in skin disorders, such as seborrheic dermatitis, which is characterized by skin scales around the nose, cheeks, and behind the ear.
  • Ocular Changes: Manifestations of deficiency also include ocular changes, such as itchy and watery eyes with sensitivity to light.
  • Red Blood Cell Production: Riboflavin is crucial for the production of red blood cells (RBCs), a deficiency of which could lead to anemia.
  • Energy Production: The vitamin plays a crucial role in energy production. It helps in metabolizing fats, ketone bodies, carbohydrates, and proteins.
  • Neurological Functions: Riboflavin helps maintain proper nervous system functions, and its deficiency could impact neurological health.
  • Sources of Riboflavin: Good sources include eggs, organ meats, lean meats, milk, and green vegetables.
  • Vulnerable Groups: Pregnant women, breastfeeding women, and those who have liver disease or malabsorption syndromes are at higher risk of riboflavin deficiency.

questions.question: What is the best source of getting protein?
questions.solution:
Concept:

  • Nutrition is the process by which food is taken in and utilized by the body.
  • Nutrients are the chemical substances present in food and are responsible for nourishing the body.
  • Nutrients are of two types:
    1. Macronutrients
    2. Micronutrients
  • Carbohydrates, proteins, fats, and oils are macronutrients.
  • Vitamins and Minerals are micronutrients.

Explanation:

  • Protein is needed in the body for bodybuilding.
  • 1 gm of protein gives 4kcal of energy.
  • Sources of protein are:
    • Animal sources- Meat, poultry, fish, eggs
    • Dairy based-Cheese, paneer
    • Plant sources- soybeans, peas, pulses, and other legumes.

​Thus, the best source of getting protein is soybean.

Additional InformationFunctions of protein are:

  • Needed for growth, maintenance, and repair of tissues.
  • Necessary for the production of enzymes, hormones, antibodies, haemoglobin, etc.
  • Help in the clotting of blood.
  • Provide energy, if necessary.

questions.question: Figure out the micronutrient from the following?&nbsp;
questions.solution:
Concept:

  • Food made up of a variety of nutrients and each one have a very specific metabolic impact on the body.
  • Nutrients are categorized in Macronutrients and Micronutrients.
  • The nutrients that your body needs in greater quantities are known as macronutrients; these include carbohydrates, protein, and fat. These supply calories, or energy, to your body.
  • The nutrients, commonly known as vitamins and minerals, that your body needs in smaller amounts are known as micronutrients.

Explanation:

  • Micronutrients are crucial for the metabolic processes of body even though they are needed in much smaller amounts.
  • A deficiency of water-soluble and fat-soluble vitamins and minerals leads to deficiency disorder such as anemia, goiter, osteoporosis, etc.
  • Vitamins are organic compounds that contain carbon. There are 13 known vitamins: Vitamin A,D,E and K are fat soluble and Vitamins B1, B2, B3, B5, B6, B7, B9, B12 and C are water-soluble.
  • Each vitamin has a specific function, such as promoting the immune system, facilitating metabolism, supporting cell growth, and enhancing healthy skin and eyes.
  • Rich sources of vitamins are berries, citrus fruits, green leafy vegetables, red and green peppers, meat and potatoes.

Additional Information

  • Protein, fats and carbohydrates are macronutrients that are largely derived from beans, legumes, whole grains, poultry, meat, milk products, etc.

Concept:

  • Nutrients are the chemical substances present in food and are responsible for nourishing the body.
